In a message dated 3/6/2005 3:17:42 A.M. Central Standard Time,  
warlord@... writes:

Once  upon a time I saw a kowakizashi saya that looked like it was "made  of
bamboo".  It was, in fact, one of the most skillfully executed  lacquer works 
I
have ever seen.  No doubt about it - real  urushi.  It had leaves and minute 
ants
also in lacquer - oh, and  signed as well.  It left me gobsmacked.  This was
really, really  top class work.  Way beyond my pocket...


Barry  Thomas.



Batmann,
I have a lacquer ( the kind with inkstone etc ) box, edo period, with  
simulated cheery tree bark.  Those artists can do wonderful  things...........
 
milt
